description: From Middle English lokinge, lokinde, lokande, lokende, from Old English lōciende, present participle of Old English lōcian (“to look”), equivalent to look +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: as the last part of compound adjectives: relating to or having the appearance of.
examples: Good-Looking, Funny Guy — (Not funny-looking, good guy), 36, Jewish, athletic.

description: From Middle English lokinge, lokunge, from Old English *lōcung (attested in Old English þurhlōcung), equivalent to look +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: The act of one who looks; a glance.
examples: A complicated interplay of lookings and viewings is in play. The staging and performance of the photograph, then, is as much the subject of the photograph as the ostensible subjects  […]
